      • findNearestValue

        public static double findNearestValue(double[] a,
                                      double value,
                                      boolean flag)
        Find the nearest value from an array relative to the given value. If flag is true then the array value should be lower than the given value. If flag is set to false then the array value should be greater than the given value. The input array is supposed to be already sorted.
        Parameters:
        a - the input array
        value - the given value
        flag - the flag
        Returns:
        the value from array

      • findNearestValueSorted

        public static double findNearestValueSorted(double[] a,
                                            double value,
                                            boolean flag)
        Same as findNearestValue but the input array is sorted in ascending order.
        Parameters:
        a - the input array
        value - the given value
        flag - the flag
        Returns:
        the value from array

      • getNearestPosition

        public static int getNearestPosition()
        Returns:
        the nearest position index corresponding to the nearest value.

        private static void qSort(double[] a,
                          int lo0,

        Quick sort algorithm
        Parameters:
        a - the array of doubles
        lo0 - input lower index
        hi0 - input upper index

        private static void qSortInt(int[] a,
                             int lo0,

        Quick sort algorithm
        Parameters:
        a - the array of ints
        lo0 - input lower index
        hi0 - input upper index

      • qSort2

        private static void qSort2(double[] a,
                           double[] b,
                           int lo0,
                           int hi0)
        Quick sorts two arrays based on ascending sorting of the first array. Changes in first array are reflected in changes in second array. Strictly speaking the second array is NOT sorted but the element positions are changed as in the first array.
        Parameters:
        a - first array
        b - second array
        lo0 - input lower index
        hi0 - input upper index

      • qSort

        public static double[] qSort(double[] a)
        Sort the array in ascending order. The input array is altered.
        Parameters:
        a - the array
        Returns:
        the sorted array (redundant)

      • qSort2

        public static void qSort2(double[] a,
                          double[] b)
        Sort 2 arrays at the same time, based on the values stored in the 1st array which is sorted in ascending order. Useful when we have a series (x,y) both x, y arrays with y = f(x) and we want to sort x in ascending order and also change the corresponding y values. The input arrays are altered during the process.
        Parameters:
        a - 1st array
        b - 2bd array

      • newQSort

        public static double[] newQSort(double[] a)
        Sort the array in ascending order. The input array is unaltered.
        Parameters:
        a - the array
        Returns:
        the sorted array

      • newQSortInt

        public static int[] newQSortInt(int[] a)
        Sort the array in ascending order. The input array is unaltered.
        Parameters:
        a - the array of integers
        Returns:
        the sorted array

      • findValue

        public static double findValue(double[] a,
                               int n)
        Find the ranked value from an array. First a new array is computed and sorted. Rank 1 corresponds to the maximum value. So, findValue(myArray, 1) returns the maximum value.
        Parameters:
        a - the array
        n - the rank
        Returns:
        the ranked value

      • validare

        @Deprecated
public static boolean validare()
        Deprecated.

public static int findHvlPosition(double[] a,
                                               int hvl,
                                               double zeroVal)
        Deprecated. 

      • findPosition

        public static int findPosition(double[] a,
                               int n)
        Find the ranked index from an array. First a new array is computed and sorted. Rank 1 corresponds to the maximum value. So, findPosition(myArray, 1) returns the index associated to the maximum value.
        Parameters:
        a - the array
        n - the rank
        Returns:
        the ranked position (index)
